Add "NRR (no response required)" to the subject line.
Add all recipients to the Bcc field.

questions.answer: It disconnects Outlook from the server to stop incoming and outgoing emails.

questions.question: Without leaving the Email page, which is the most efficient way to add the contact of someone who sent you an email?
questions.answer: Copy and paste their email address into a new contact form.
correctAnswer: Copy and paste their email address into a new contact form.
options: Copy and paste their email address into a new contact form.
Open the email and press Ctrl+Q (Windows) or Command + Q (Mac).

On Windows, right-click the sender's name in the message and select Add to Outlook Contacts. On Mac, Control+click the sender's name in the message and select Open Outlook contact > Add to Contacts > Save and then Close.
Double-click the sender's email address in the message and select Add to Outlook Contacts (Windows) or Open Outlook contacts (Mac).

questions.question: Why would you change the Outlook setting to **Work Offline**? You can adjust this setting on the Send and Receive tab (Windows) or the **Outlook** menu (Mac).
questions.answer: It disconnects Outlook from the server to stop incoming and outgoing emails to avoid sending or receiving messages while using a slow or unstable connection, or to avoid being charged for connection while traveling.
correctAnswer: It disconnects Outlook from the server to stop incoming and outgoing emails to avoid sending or receiving messages while using a slow or unstable connection, or to avoid being charged for connection while traveling.
options: It stops incoming emails but allows outgoing emails.
It disconnects the computer from the network to avoid network slowdowns.
It allows incoming emails but stops outgoing emails.

It disconnects Outlook from the server to stop incoming and outgoing emails to avoid sending or receiving messages while using a slow or unstable connection, or to avoid being charged for connection while traveling.

questions.question: Shanti Keller is the only person named Shanti in your contacts. You have typed "Shanti" in the To address box, and the name Shanti Adams appears. Why might this happen?
questions.answer: You previously received and replied to an email from Shanti Adams. Autocomplete is now automatically suggesting her name and email address.
correctAnswer: You previously received and replied to an email from Shanti Adams. Autocomplete is now automatically suggesting her name and email address.
options: Shanti Adams appears in your coworker's personal contact list. Although you and your coworker do not share an Outlook account, Shanti Adams appears in your personal contacts, too.
Shanti Adams was mentioned in a Teams meeting and was listed in the Meeting Insights without an email address.
You previously received and replied to an email from Shanti Adams. Autocomplete is now automatically suggesting her name and email address.
It is random. If you type "Shanti" again, Shanti Keller may appear.

questions.question: What happens when you add an additional email account in Outlook?
questions.answer: Outlook prompts you for the transmission protocol you would like to use.; Right-click (Windows) or Control+click (Mac) the message and select **Save All Attachments**.
questions.explanation: ## Q100. You recieved a message with five attachments and need to save all of them in your Documents folder. How can you efficiently accomplish this?
correctAnswer: Outlook prompts you for the transmission protocol you would like to use.
Right-click (Windows) or Control+click (Mac) the message and select **Save All Attachments**.
options: Outlook stops you because you can only use one email account at a time.
Outlook prompts you for the transmission protocol you would like to use.
Outlook automatically applies the default configurations.
Outlook prompts you to remove an exisiting account first.
Click the **Download All** link below the attachments (Windows) or expand the attachment menu and select **Save All Attachments** (Mac)
Open each attachment and use the Save command in the application to save to your Documents folder.
Expand the attachment menu and select **Save All Attachments** (Windows) or click the **Download All** (Mac) link below the attachments.
Right-click (Windows) or Control+click (Mac) the message and select **Save All Attachments**.
